heading: ***COLD WEATHER ADVISORIES FROM THE CHAMPLAIN VALLEY EAST, AND EXTREME COLD WARNINGS IN THE ADIRONDACKS AND SOUTHERN MOUNTAINS SATURDAY AFTERNOON AND SUNDAY***Today
text: Periods of sunshine giving way to clouds. A chance of snow in NY and the St. Lawrence Valley late in the day. Highs ranging through the 20s. Light winds, becoming south up to 10 mph.

heading: Tonight
text: Periods of light snow spreading east. Accumulations of an inch or two. Lows 10 to 15, except 5 below to 5 above in the St. Lawrence and northern NY. Winds south to southeast 5 to 10 mph, diminishing to light.

heading: Saturday
text: Periods of morning snow, tapering off west to east. Turning much colder. Highs north from zero in NY to the teens in NH, and teens to low 20s south, steady or falling through the day. Winds becoming west to northwest 10 to 15 mph, gusting 20 to 30 mph.
